articles.title: South Africa cuts down pine trees in desperate bid to save water - CBC.ca
articles.description: An environmental group in drought-stricken Cape Town, South Africa, is helping to cut down 54,000 hectares of invasive pine trees in the city's watershed to free up 55 billion litres of water lost each year to the trees. (Mike Hutchings/Reuters)
